author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Execute following line:

Enter-PSSession -HostName 10.0.0.26 -UserName Administrator      
## Expected behavior

To connect to Windows Server 2016 and give a PowerShell prompt,
## Actual behavior

When trying to connect ti fails giving the following error:

PS /home/maxt> Enter-PSSession -HostName 10.0.0.26 -UserName Administrator  
Enter-PSSession : The background process reported an error with the following 
message: The SSH client session has ended with error message: ssh: connect to 
host 10.0.0.26 port 22: Connection timed out.
At line:1 char:1
- Enter-PSSession -HostName 10.0.0.26 -UserName Administrator
- ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  - CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (:) [Enter-PSSession], PSRe 
    motingTransportException
  - FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSRemoting 
    DataStructureException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.EnterPSSessionCommand

![linuxtowindowserr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/19364540/960b7e3c-915c-11e6-949a-137fe073d786.png)
## Environment data

Windows OS Name: Microsoft Windows 2016 GA Build 14393

Linux: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS Desktop

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.10> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value

---

PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
WSManStackVersion              3.0
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
CLRVersion
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.10
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PSEdition                      Core

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Almost there!
1. Windows to Linux Ubuntu- Good
2. Linux Ubuntu to Linux Fedora - Good
3. Linux Fedora to Linux Ubuntu - Good
4. Linux Ubuntu to Windows - Fail

I'm hoping is a setting issue! But is looking good.
:)

![allwayremoting](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/19367921/6d595932-916b-11e6-9571-f7a941bd1a35.png)

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: @MaximoTrinidad As the error message says, the error is coming from SSH and it is unable to connect to your Windows machine.  Try connecting directly with SSH (ssh Administrator@10.0.0.26) and you will likely get the same ssh client error.  Have you tried pinging the Windows machine?

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: I am not able to repro this.  I can do SSH remoting from Ubuntu machine to Windows machine by passing in the password.  There were some earlier bugs where this didn't work due to set up errors and the error message was not clear.  I believe these are fixed now and any error message coming from SSH client is returned.

comments.author: treii28
comments.body:
I'm getting this error now but I am able to ssh into my user account. I checked the InnerException as per your suggestion on close #2525 but it was empty.

Oh wait, looking closer, mine is saying 'The SSH client session has ended with the error message: subsystem request failed on channel 0."

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: @treii28 Check the powershell subsystem line in your sshd_config file.  The subsystem path/name is likely no longer valid.  I have been experimenting with Enable-SSHRemoting prototype, that helps set up and verify a PowerShell SSH remoting endpoint, but I have not had time to work on it recently.

title: PSRP over SSH from Linux to Windows fails after password
